column3: description
column4: //* forces case sensitive,  ~ separates variations of words ex: "video ~video,~video." will not match VideoRay

column3: A device used to measure acceleration - used to determine pitch and roll of the ROV
An optional device that can be used with the VideoRay system to augment its features and capabilities
ROV connection for ROV mounted accessories that provides access to power and data circuits
Using sound as a method of communicating underwater - often used to measure distance
The height of the ROV off of the bottom
See Attitude Indicator
Instrument that provides an indication of the pitch and roll of the ROV
(Automatic White Balance) color corrects an image - See also White Balance
Control Feature that maintains the altitude of the ROV at a constant value
Control Feature that maintains the depth of the ROV at a constant value
Control Feature that maintains the heading (compass direction) of the ROV at a constant value
Control Feature that maintains the pitch of the ROV at a constant value
Control Feature that maintains the roll of the ROV at a constant value
Weights used to decrease buoyancy of the ROV to achieve desired buoyancy
The tendency to float, sink or remain at a constant depth
The camera provides a video image from the ROV
Method to control image focus or the current state of image focus
Method to control the vertical angle of the camera or the current state of camera tilt
Unit of measure of temperature
Method to ensure all operations are completed as planned or functions perform as expected
The Close button exits ROV Control Software
Instrument that provides an indication of the heading of the ROV
The state or being able to work together
Primary topside component required to run the ROV control software
The surface component that provides power and communications with the ROV
The flow of water or electricity
The ability to change the operation or behavior of the system to make it more suitable for specific applications
An optional ROV mounted device for cutting objects
Allows data from the ROV to be exported to external applications
Allows data from external applications or sensors to be displayed on the video as overlay text
Calendar Date
Vertical location of the ROV within the water measured from the surface
Method of controlling the depth of the ROV
Display that indicates the current depth of the ROV
Maximum depth for operation of the ROV
Method for identifying the cause of a problem
The process of modifying data
Data Protocol and connector style
Method to communicate data from the ROV to other systems
Initial state of a variety of parameters
Unit of measure of temperature
Indication of a problem
Unit of measure of length or distance
Software that resides on the ROV modules
Required ROV component used to increase buoyancy of the ROV - counteracted by ballast to achieve desired buoyancy
Setting to control the level of some parameter
AC power source that typically runs on gasoline or diesel fuel
(Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter) A safety circuit
(Geographic Positioning System) Device that provides location
Input device to control the ROV's operation
The compass direction the ROV is facing
Information intended to provide assistance
Qualitative measure of the amount of moisture in the air
(International Electrotechnical Commission) Power cord connector standard
Method to receive and process data from other systems
User Control Software interface feature to display information or control features
AC power source that runs on battery
Input device for controlling the surge and yaw of the ROV
Camera element used to capture and focus light to create an image
ROV component that provides lights for scene illumination in dark areas
(Line Insulation Monitor) A safety circuit
Protective covering over the camera
An optional ROV mounted device for grabbing objects
Unit of measure of length or distance
A method to prepare for a successful ROV operation
Device used for the display of the video or computer image
Feature of the documentation that allows users to add personal notes to the online pages
A state of buoyancy in which the ROV will sink and a type of tether
A state of buoyancy in which the ROV will maintain it's vertical location and a type of tether
Sealing device
Unable to see through
Text or logo superimposed on the video
The nose-up or nose-down attitude or motion of the ROV
A state of buoyancy in which the ROV will float and a type of tether
(Professional Performance Tether) A type of tether
A device to measure pressure - used to calculate ROV depth
ROV component with pitched blades that generate thrust when rotated
Command to initiate video capture to a storage media
The underwater vehicle
A connector Style with 8 contacts commonly used for Ethernet connections
The left or right leaning attitude or motion of the ROV
See Remotely Operated Vehicle
Data Protocol
State of, or application of, safe practices
(Software Developer's Kit) A program and a set of software libraries and utilities to aid custom program development
The amount of output based on a specific level of input, particularly for the joystick
An instrument for measuring a specific property of an object or the environment
The values of specific controls or parameters, or the ability to manage these
The base of the ROV and often used to mount accessories
See SDK
A still image captured from the video image
An ROV and tether component that reduces the load on tether connections
Device used to shade the display for better visibility in direct sunlight
The forward and backward motion of the ROV
(Tether Deployment System) A reel for storing tether
Qualitative measure of hot or cold
The cable that connects the ROV to the User Control Console
See TDS
Ability to superimpose text over a video image
Rotational motion of the joystick - can be used as an alternate control method of the joystick
ROV propulsion system including a motor and propeller
Shroud around the propeller
User Control Console component to adjust the angle of the optional second monitor
Ability to see through
An instrument that keeps track of the number of rotations of the ROV about its vertical axis and provides information on which direction to turn to unwind the tether
See also Tether
A newer version or the process of installing a newer version
(Universal Serial Bus) Data protocol and connector style
In VideoRay context, the image from the ROV's camera or the ability to record this image
Defines a method of storing a video image within a file format
Display component that displays the video image from the camera
A software feature that allows two applications on the same computer to communicate without requiring physical ports
Measure of the clarity of water
A short length of tether attached to the ROV or User Control console
Camera feature to color correct images from the camera
The left or right turning attitude or motion of the ROV
Camera image magnification
